comment_text:
Workers stack the trays in a drying room. It's heated and humidified with steam. The candy wafers stay here until their moisture level drops to between 0.75 and 1%.

Sad day when NECCO closed.  Lost some half dozen or more candies that go back to late 1800’s.    Brachs Candies tried to take over the Valentines Day candy hearts after NECCO closed and failed miserably.   Brachs’ candies were rock hard and they sold only about 1/4 of their production for the year. Their total production was only a fraction of the normal yearly NECCO supply that nearly always sold out.
